Hey Lawdogg! Why didn't Oblitertron take damage from Gigan's shots? 

As Gigan fought, he suddenly noticed how damaged the Cybertronian Fire was.
He then began fighting even more fiercly by launching two missiles at 
Obliterron, and turning, fired 6 shells from his blast cannon at Sixshot.
nbwrpg@egroups.com wrote:
>
> (Dang comp, about to finish a reply and it cuts me off an' doesn't let me 
> save the e-mail. �Sorry if this is sloppy, but when I write out a long 
e-mail 
> and it's lost, I do a poor job rewriting it.
> 
> Cyberwolf, I fired at you via Serpentor at point blank range with a plasma 
> launcher and slashed at your side with an energy blade. �You posted you 
> pushed the weapon to the side, and left you exposed. �Now, if that were 
true, 
> Serpentor would've struck you rather hard in the side with the blade. �But 
> you posted it hit Luna's thigh. �I won't be posting with 'Pentor until you 
> fix that)
> 
> 
> Oblitertron/Sixshot/Dark Wolf/Double 
> Punch/Injector/Manterror/Bumblebee/Ares/Nemesis 
> Enforcer/Scattershot/Firestarter/
> Chordate/Unitron:
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Oblitertron watched as Hysteria ran, and let out a hoarse laugh. �He saw 
> Angel Prime, which looked a fire ball, head for him. �He laughed, knowing 
his 
> gigantic form was rather impervious to fire (as was the team member who 
> formed his left arm, Pyro). �As Angel Prime struck him, he stepped 
backwards 
> several meters, but fired off three optic blasts at Angel. �
> 
> The gestalt's chest had a large (not a deep dent) dent in his chest where 
> Angel Prime had hit, and it couldn't be told if he had been burned since 
his 
> chets was pure black, as was most of his entire body. �But he wasn't hurt 
by 
> the flames.
> 
> ---
> 
> Sixshot swerved his turret, firing off eight shots, two from all four of 
his 
> cannons. �The first six were intercepted by the shields. �But with a bright 
> flicker, the shields disappeared, and were gone. �The remaining two struck 
> the hull of the CF, doing insignificant damage.
> 
> ---
> 
> Dark Wolf let out a howl, firing off three optic blasts at the Cybertronian 
> Fire. �The blasts struck the hull, leaving a deep impression in the side.
> 
> ---
> 
> Double Punch watched as all the shots missed him. �He raised his pinchers, 
> but heard a whistling sound. �He hadn't noticed the second missile 
Sideswipe 
> had fired, adn was struck in the chest, and hit the ground. �He knew his 
> cloak was down, and cursed.
> 
> He raised both pinchers, firing off two energy signature seeking missiles, 
> one from both pinchers. �He had fired one in return at Sideswipe, and one 
at 
> Torca. �He launched his cyber bee, Cyberline, from his left wrist, and 
> watched the mechanical insect gain altitude quickly, its insect optics 
> glowing a bright green.
> 
> ---
> 
> Manterror dodged the missiles and most of the shots by going hard left, 
three 
> blasts striking his side and weakening the armor significantly, though not 
> penetrating. �Though they did knock him out of the way of Grimmler's shots, 
> but the Alliance member didn't even notice that Maximal was firing on him. �
> He raised both arms, firing off three ion disks from both. �Three ion disks 
> lanced out at Ratchet's chest, three more headed for the Maximal's left 
foot.
> 
> ---
> 
> Injector raised an arm, firing off two stinger missiles, intercepting all 
but 
> two nails, the two striking him a little ways below his neck. �He raised 
his 
> free arm, firing of two stinger missiles at Torca's abdomen. �
> 
> ---
> 
> Bumblebee fired off three rapid optic blasts, disintegrating eight nails. �
> The remaining ones stuck in his abdomen. �They were small and didn't cause 
> much damage, but they did cause some leaking, which hurt. �Bumblebee raised 
> both arms with a cry of pain, and fired off two stinger missiles from the 
> launcher in each hand, four stinger missiles launching out at Torca's chest.
> 
> ---
> 
> Ares jumped back, avoiding most of Ice's energy ball, part of the energy 
> reaching the tip of his foot, but it didn't cause anything. �He fired off 
> four bolts from his rifle at Ice's chest.
> 
> ---
> 
> Nemesis Enforcer saw IR doing weird stuff, and knew she was charging up 
some 
> kind of weapon. �He transformed into his bat mode, with a wingspan of 
thirty 
> feet. �He covered up his animal body the best he could, part of the blast 
> engulfing the front of him, but the blast was bigger than Nemesis' bat 
mode, 
> and the rest continued on.
> 
> Nemesis dropped to the grown in pain, his wings sizzling. �He transformed 
> into biped mode painly, the legs of his bat mode bleeding mech-fluid. �He 
> stood up painfully, inspecting his wings and yelled. �They were at a 30% 
> integrity. �Usually it was long in a battle until they were hurt that bad. �
> He cursed as they were charred and black. �He held his wings aloft even 
> though it hurt pretty bad, and launched into the air. �"SCATTERSHOT!" he 
> yelled into his comm, "Pattern Omega-Boom on the witch!" he yelled, pulling 
> out a missile launcher from subspace and gaining altitude painfully. �He 
was 
> so enraged, he didn't notice the rest of IR's blast was heading straight 
for 
> the Cybertronian Fire itself, its shields now down from previous attacks.
> 
> ---
> 
> Scattershot saw the two incoming blasts, one aimed at his head, one aimed 
at 
> his propulsion system, which was in his feet. �He transformed into eagle 
> mode, the blasts going by harmlessly, his size decreased by more than three 
> times because of the transformation. �He transformed back to biped mode, 
> receiving Nemesis Enforcer's transmission.
> 
> "Acknowledged." he said, moving his left arm to point at Tavatron, firing 
off 
> fifteen explosive rounds from his automatic rifle at her torso. �A charge 
> appeared in his left hand from subspace. �He threw the charge, which was 
set 
> to explode on impact, at Iron Raptor's right side.
> 
> ---
> 
> Unitron cursed as Hot Rod got a hold of his feet, and fell to his back. 
�His 
> mind raced for a brief second, but then he picked up a familiar signature. �
> "Firestarter..." he whispered. �"No time for you!" he yelled, raising his 
> rifle and firing off three bolts at Hot Rod's chest, a single optic blast 
> lancing out at his abdomen as he pulled his leg free and got to his feet, 
> powering up his feet boosters.
> 
> ---
> 
> Firestarter saw the unmistakable form. �How could you miss someone who was 
> almost identicle to an entity that had nearly destroyed your home planet? �
> Firestarter had been at that battle...
> 
> He hovered for a brief second, then descending down towards Unitron, a T 
> shaped hilt appearing from his personal subspace pocket into his right arm. 
�
> He pressed on the bottom of the hilt, a blade of flames forming.
> 
> ==
> 
> Chordate shook and yelled out, slamming a fist on the console he was at. 
�The 
> main one was destroyed, and there was no time to fix it. �He heard someone 
> enter, and turned, raising his laser rifle to aim at Hysteria's head. �But 
> his scans said she was a Maximal, so he lowered his weapon, but kept it in 
> hand, and took a moment to build up strength to answer her useless question.
> 
> His face was caked with dry mech-fluid, and the numerous cuts were still 
> bleeding. �Internal scans done by himself revealed that he had lost too 
much 
> mech-fluid. �Though he wasn't seriously injured and it would take a long 
time 
> for him to die from his wounds, it was inevitable at this rate in the 
> Maximal/Alliance battle. �Anyone who knew him wouldn't recognize him by 
> seeing his face. �Instead of being proud, he was slumped, and his face 
looked 
> tired and worn, not to mention it was covered in mech-fluid like a mask. 
�He 
> pressed a few buttons.
> 
> "Shields are gone. �Hull integrity at 86%," he sighed. �The base shook and 
he 
> slammed a fist on a console, activating a comm. link to Iron Raptor. 
�"HEY!" 
> he yelled. �"WATCH IT YOU BUCKET FOR BRAINS! �DON'T SHOOT MY SLAGGING 
SHIP!" 
> he yelled loudly. �He wasn't in the mood for pleasantries, or these Past 
> Earth Maximals' countless screw ups.
> 
> "Tell me," he said, "do all Maximals who stay on this planet to long end up 
> being complete idiots?"
>
